wikipedia_page.main: Charles Warren (19 March 1764 – 12 August 1829) was an English barrister and politician, judge and amateur cricketer.

response: Charles Warren (1840–1927) was a British Army officer and head of the London Metropolitan Police.
Charles Warren may also refer to:
* Charles Warren (California politician) (1927–2019), California State Assemblyman and chairman of the Council on Environmental Quality
* Charles Warren (U.S. author) (1868–1954), American legal historian, winner of the Pulitzer Prize
* Charles Warren (MP) (1764–1829), English barrister and politician, judge and amateur cricketer
* Charles Warren (cricketer, born 1843) (1843–1919), English clergyman and cricketer

With his brother John, Losh had instruction from the local curate, William Gaskin, and then went to the academy of John Dawson. He was trained up for university at school in Penrith, and matriculated in 1782 at Trinity College, Cambridge. John Tweddell was a close friend from college, as was John Bell the barrister.Diaries vol. i, p. xvii Another friend from this time was Charles Warren.Jeffrey Smith, James Losh: his ideas in relation to his circle and his time (PDF), at p. 29.
